RISK
 ----Basic Rules----
 -The goal of the game is to take all the territories on the map.
 -There is a total of 42 territories making up 6 different continents.
 -Played with 2-6 players.
 -The color of your name in te top left corner coresponds to the territoris you own.
 -There are 3 phases to each turn: Deploy, Attack, and Fortify. The Phase of each players turn can be seen in the center bar above the map. Players can move between these phases and end their turn once done with these phases by hitting the next button in the bottom right corner.
 -Which player’s turn it is can be seen in the top left next to the Phase bar by displaying the player’s name who’s turn it is. In addition, this name will be colored, indicated what color each player is and can be used to identify which territories each player owns which also have their troop numbers colored to match the player’s color.
 -Click exit button to exit game.


Set-Up
 -The game will automatically give each player an equal number of territories and an equal number of troops randomly deployed to each of their territories. The game will then start with player one in the deploy phase.


----Gameplay----


Deploy
 -At the beginning of each turn each player receives a given number of troops to deploy to their owned territories. The player can deploy as many of their given troops to any number of territories that they own.
 -To deploy troops to territories a player simply must tap on a territory they own, type the number of troops the want to deploy to that territory, and hit confirm. The new total number of troops for that territory will be displayed on the territory.


Deployment troop count
 -The number of troops each player gets to deploy at the start of their turn is automatically calculated by taking the number of territories the player owns and dividing it by 3. Players will always get at least 3 troops no matter the number of territories.


Continent Bonuses
 -Controlling all the territories in each continent at the beginning of a player’s turn gives a troop bonus for deployment in addition to the troops calculated from the number of territories. Each continent can be seen by the clear coloring of each. Each continent gives its own bonus, and any player can receive any number of bonuses.
 -Oceania (Australia) = 2 troops
 -South America = 2 troops
 -Africa = 3 troops
 -North America = 5 troops
 -Europe = 5 troops
 -Asia = 7 troops


Card bonus
 -Card bonuses must be played by viewing the cards and hitting the exchange button during the deploy phase. See cards sections for more details.


Attack
 -Players can attack enemy territories by first selecting the territory they want to attack from, hitting confirm without entering a number, then selecting an adjacent territory they want to attack and hitting confirm. This should automatically roll the die and randomly decide which players lost troops in the attack and properly subtract troops from either side.
 -A player can attack as many times as they want, or not, in a turn until they either run out of troops to attack with next to enemy territories.
 -If a player defeat all of the enemy’s troops in a territory they then take control of that territory, moving whatever number of troops they want from their own attack territory to an enemy territory.


Fortify
 -Each player can only fortify once per turn or skip this phase, ending their turn. Players can only fortify to territories they own that are connected by a chain of owned territories.
 -Players can fortify by simply selecting the territory they want to fortify from and entering in the number of troops they want to move and hit confirm. They then selected a connected territory to fortify to, reenter the number of troops to fortify, and hit confirm. At the end of this fortify movement the system should automatically end the player’s turn.


Cards
 -Cards are received when players successfully take an enemy territory but only one card can be earned per turn. Players can only hold a maximum of 5 cards and can only play 3 at a time. Players can view cards by hitting the cards button in the bottom left-hand corner and cards will be automatically played if a player has 5 cards. To play cards players must hit the exchange button in the cards view and the system will automatically use the cards that maximize then number of troops received. If a player has five cards at the beginning for their turn during the deploy phase, three of them will be automatically played giving the most troop bonus possible.
 -There are 4 different combinations of cards that can be played
 -3 Infantry cards: 4 troop total
 -3 Calvary cards: 6 troop total
 -3 Artillery cards: 8 troop total
 -One of each type of card (1 Infantry, 1 Calvary, 1 Artillery): 10 troop total
